body:
It would be a core change,  so will it be discussed in the next TSC meeting?
Temporaryly labeled `tsc`, but feel free to remove if no need. ðŸ˜

> content of the for loop should be inside TDZ

I'm not sure about it. Temporal Dead Zone is a timing matter (`Temporal` means a thing about time). I.e., if it touches a certain variable before that variable declaration executes then it throws a ReferenceError. For example:

```js
function foo() {
    a
}

foo() // throws a ReferenceError because `let a` hasn't executed. This is in TDZ.
let a
foo() // works because `let a` has executed. This is not in TDZ.
```

In the following code:

```js
for (let key in obj) {
  const a = obj[key];
}
```

~~TDZ doesn't exist because we cannot touch the `key` variable before the variable declaration executes.~~ EDIT: Indeed, `ForInStatement#right` can touch the `key` variable as similar to `let a = a`.

Anyway, `eslint-scope` analyzes the structure about variables, references and scopes. It cannot address the timing matter.

Ah, I see. Thanks for the explanation. In that case, I'm in support of this change (I think). I do think it has potential to break some of the rules, though. So we need to be careful about introducing it.

issue.title: Breaking: remove TDZScope (refs eslint/eslint#10245)
issue.body:
Refs eslint/eslint#10245.

This PR removes `TDZScope` class.
`eslint-scope` package should not make TDZ scopes because this is static analyzer and Temporal Dead Zone is a timing matter.

As results:

- `for-in`/`for-of` statements no longer make TDZ scopes.
- The references in `ForInStatement#right` and `ForOfStatement#right` are in the correct place now.

I confirmed that `eslint` doesn't need any fix for this change (eslint/eslint#10270).

issue.title: Breaking: remove TDZ scopes (fixes #10245)

issue.body:
**What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to item)**

[X] Bug fix: fixes #10245.

**What changes did you make? (Give an overview)**

This PR upgrades `eslint-scope` package to remove TDZ scopes.
This depends on `github:eslint/eslint-scope#remove-tdz-scope` in order to check no test failing. 

**Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?**

Nothing in particular.

body:
**TSC Summary**: ESLint should not make TDZ scope objects as a structural matter because TDZ is a timing matter. TDZ scopes have caused a bug (#10227). The removal does not have any effect to core rules, at least in our tests (#10270).
**TSC Question**: Should we accept this change -- remove TDZ scopes?
This issue was accepted in [today's TSC meeting](https://github.com/eslint/tsc-meetings/blob/c271eee0c355058b90acb511a6e70a0c4520b121/notes/2018/2018-04-26.md#remove-tdz-scopes).
